Html.content:
All content snippets on a page have to be placed in sections. Since the overview of the page's topic is already given in the topic content itself, it should not be a real restriction. It's more a guide on how to structure topics.

Sections store meta information. In particular it stores information about:

  • The documentation version the section was added or improved
  • The OpenCms version the described feature was added or improved
  • Status information, in particular TODOs

Further specific functions are:

  • Sections have identifiers that are rendered as anchors, such you can link directly to a section.
  • Sections set there Title property automatically as "page's Title property - section headline". Set the property via the content only if you want to change this default behavior.
  • The level of a section has to be set via an element setting.
  • Sections are automatically numbered and added to the page index.
  • Todos of sections are automatically collected by an editor tool.
